STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 9, 2022
Alison Morrison
Gratiot County DHHS
201 Commerce Drive
Ithaca, MI 48847
RE: License #: CP290201154
Gratiot County DHHS
201 Commerce Drive
Ithaca, MI 48847
Dear Ms. Morrison:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 08/30/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (866) 685-0006.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements reviewed.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-6B The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every FTM.
Three of the three current foster child records reviewed contained at least one
completed FTM that did not include a DHS-1105 that could be located at the time
of this review. The first example had 3 out of 4 completed FTMs without a DHHS-
1105, the second example had 3 out of 5 completed FTMs without a DHHS-1105,
and the third example had 2 out of 4 completed FTMs with a DHHS-1105.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of corporal punishment during this licensing period.
The agency has not submitted any acceptable corrective action plans not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The renewal evaluation completed 06/17/2021 did not identify any noncompliance
and a corrective action plan was not required.
Trends and Repeat Violation Assessment
The agency did not have any areas of repeat noncompliance.
4

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment reviewed the issue of unplanned
disruptions/discharges. A corrective action plan was not required for the previous
review.
Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences and no concerns
were identified.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
09/01/2022
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
09/08/2022
________________________________________
Kari Muntean Date
Area Manager
